item.title: Dangerous holes appearing, 23rd February
item.description:
This is an ongoing issue and the area around it is becoming waterlogged, slippery and all grass has been dug up. Holes are appearing on a regular basis. It’s an unsightly mess on what was a lovely green area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Lyndhurst Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Direction sign moving with the wind direction, 23rd February
item.description:
In front of The Old Police Station on the corner of North St. and Greet Rd., Winchcombe. The GWR Winchcombe Station sign at the top of the post points in whatever direction the wind blows. The top section of the post appears to be loose. The photo shows approx. 180 degs out. The post is in a very poor condition and may probably eventually fail ,with potential H&S implications.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, North Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is misaligned (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Water pour out from drain, 23rd February
item.description:
Between house "The Willows" and 1 whitefields road the drain is located. Water pours out from drain during and after it has rained for hours. Original cast iron drain covers had fallen inside the

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: After heavy rain, water emerges from under pavement. The pavement is now crumbling away., 23rd February
item.description:
Outside the house called Stonecrop (which we own and rent out to tenants). The problem has been going on for years. In the Winter, water spreads over the road then freezes and becomes a hazard. We would like to get the issue fixed somehow. I asked Severn Trent and they said it was a Highways issue. Recently, we had some work done on the water supply pipe to the house and the builders found a broken clay pipe which appeared to be an old land drain - and it was flowing strongly after rain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
